item.title: From: Ruth, To: Ruby Chandler
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
From: Ruth, To: Ruby Chandler Postcard Info: Mailed from Mount Pulaski, Illinois on July 27, 1962 Picture Info: Court house in which Lincoln practiced law. Mt. Pulaski, Illinois 1962

Miss Ruby Chandler Pearl, Illinois Pike County

The pictures, I printed were all good-every one took that Sunday. Well on the good side, your mother and Bess can come up next week-well all are good and I wish to show her a good time. Hear you made a thourough study of chemistry . Well last beau-write Ruby!!! Write me , for oh so nightly------humor me. Soon ever, Ruth

item.title: From: Betty, To: Amelia J. Wiggins
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
From: Betty Ann Tilley, To: Amelia J. Wiggins Mailed From: Topeka, Kansas on February 24, 1942

Mrs. B. A. Tilley 1312 Harrison Topeka, Kansas

Mrs. Amelia J. Wiggins 725 Waverly Route 5 Columbus, Ohio

Tokepa, Kansas Feb. 24-42 Dearest Auntie, It isn't because we forgot you dear that we do not write but I am so busy all the time. This house is so big and always extra work to be done. Bertie comes usually of noon lunch and I try to write Harold every day. He is in Watertown, South Dakota. Mother not very well. She occasionally dries dishes for me but that is about all she can do. Hire very little help. Bert, Louie, and Harold are all pretty well. I keep fair. Hope darling you and your little pet are both all right. Wish you would write us a card. Love, Niece Betty 1312 Harrison

item.title: From: Betty Tilley, To: Amelua J. Wiggins
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
From: Betty Tilley, To:  Amelia J. Wiggins Mailed From: Topeka, Kansas on June 30, 1941

Mrs. Amelia J. Wiggins 725 Waverly Route 5 Columbus, Ohio

Mrs. H.W. Tilley Hotel Paumee Merik Platte, Nebraska

Dearest Aunt Millie, We are in a hurry, ready to leave Topeka for Merik Platte Nebraska, Hotel Paumee. Enclosed is a letter Maifer wrote you some time ago. It is almost impossible for her to write as her vision is so bad. She can not read at all. Maifer is going to Merik Platte with me. Shall write you again when hot in such a rush to leave town. Have a four hundred mile drive ahead of us. We hope you are feeling better dear. I am awfully bust all the time. Together with caring for Maifer and this big house it is so much for me. We are all pretty well however. Hope to hear from you, maybe you know some one who will send us a card to The Paumee Htel at Merik Platte Nebraska. Love from both of us. Your devoted niece Betty (Mrs. H.W. Tilley)

item.title: From: Lucy Clarkin, To: Amelia J. Wiggins
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
From: Lucy Clarkin, To: Amelia J. Wiggins Mailed From: San Diego on May 21, 1938

Mrs. Lucy C. Clarkin 2062 Venice St. Ocean Beach San Diego, California

Mrs. A.J. Wiggins 725 Waverly St. K-5 Columbus, Ohio

Mrs. A.J. Wiggins May 21, 1938 Dear, dear, dear, friend, Here I am starting an air mail letter to you. We are having real May weather here now. Some fog and light showers at night. Just now the radio is reporting the crash of an air plane against a mountain top and burning, fatal to all on board. My neighbor is laid up for repairs. She had a pretty complete Xray. She would like to have me with her all the time but I stay away when I know someone else is there. Rheumatism and sciatica are bothering me some. Pretty painful if I do not take Iodide of Potash regularly. 1/4 of an ounce in 4 ounce of water. A tablespoon after meals is the regular dose but I take 2 teaspoons twice a day and get along pretty well. I have not heard from Celia. She has probably joined up with her children. Maybe she and her children are probably leading regular Indian lives and living on fish and pinion nuts. I heard a number of air planes roaring overhead during the night. Air mail week and not good weather for flying but things may be clearing up. I am enclosing an Easter Card I mislaid and did not send. California poppies are out in my yard, very beautiful. My doctor and my dentist are waiting to finish my job. I am intending to write to the grand-daughter-in-law of a 91 year old cousin of my mother an air mail letter with a dime for the old man. Love & much love, Lucy C. Clarkin Had a severe stomach and heart attack last night. Bad indigestion. Am sending Celia an Air Mail letter asking her to write to you.

item.title: From: Paul Knox and Family, To: Jeanette Knox Chandler
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: From: Paul Knox and Family, To: Jeanette Knox Chandler Mailed From: Jacksonville, Illinois on December 22, 1930

item.title: From: Grace Chandler, To: Jeanette Knox Chandler
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
From: Grace Chandler, To: Jeanette Knox Chandler Mailed From: Kansas City, MO. on August 28, 1930 Postcard Info: Made in U.S.A. by E.C. Kropp Co., Milwaukee Picture Info: The Palisades on Kersey Coates Drive, Kansas City, Mo.

Mrs. E.H. Chandler Pearl, Illinois

Thursday a.m. Dear Folks, On our way home, arrived here at 5:45 will leave at 8:30 and get into St. Louis at 6 p.m. Have had a nice trip and a lovely time - will either write or come up soon. Hope you are both well. Received your nice long letter. Love, Grace

item.title: From: Opal Chandler, To: Jeanette Knox Chandler
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
From: Opal Chandler, To: Jeanette Knox Chandler Postcard Info: Published by Weaver-Fagerstrom, Inc., Pueblo, Colo. Made in USA. Picture Info: Union Depot, Pueblo, Colo. Mailed From: Pueblo, Colo on June 11, 1921

Mrs. Elijah H. Chandler Pearl, Illinois

Pueblo loots June, 10-21 I arrived before the flood and got to take in all that was left. It sure was awful. No one can imagine how bad it was. But my friends live up high. Will let Ruby know when to expect me. Opal The water was in this depot.

item.title: From: Liam, To: Elijah H. Chandler
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
From: Liam, To: Elijah H. Chandler Postcard Info: Co-Mo Foto Co., Watertown, Wis. Picture Info: Main Street East Dunlap IA. 08250 Mailed From: Dunlap, Iowa on June 5, 1921

Mr. Elijah H. Chandler Pearl, Illinois

6/4 Sat. Got here about 7 pm. Had a good trip in two days, and everybody O.K. Just drove 8 hours to Crepo looking for girls. Will write soon. Hello to all, Liam Mrs. Rush mentioned that she is getting along O.K.

item.title: From: Lorin, To: Martin Chandler
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
From: Lorin, To: Martin Chandler Mailed From: Latonia State College  on June 6, 1919

Mr. Martin Chandler Pearl, Illinois

6/6 Dear folks, Dropped in here for rest today. Fine weather. We will be at Morrisonville 1st. We ought to be at Pearl 4th. Hope all there are well. We are. Love to all, Lorin

item.title: From: Unknown, To: Elijah H. Chandler
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
From: Unknown, To: Elijah H. Chandler Mailed From: Cincinnati, Ohio on November 8, 1918

Mr. E.H. Chandler Pearl, Illinois

Cincinnati, Ohio 11/1/18, Time: 5:45 My train leaves 7 pm for Magsully. There is where I guess we will meet. Will be able to be home each night except Thursday. Fine traveling on Ohio River, 6000 purple. Will try and bring Grace a map or so you will have to have your Bess read to Maysville. I guess nice people and I believe there all like me O.K. Again later
